attributes.action: stop the Chancellor's plan to levy a £30,000 surcharge on non-domiciled taxpayers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Alistair Darling’s Finance Bill 2008 proposes a regressive £30,000 levy on non-domiciled workers with more than 7 years residence, coupled with the option to be taxed on worldwide income. The proposal unfairly singles out non-affluent foreigners who work here and support the UK economy. It is a gratuitous slap to some of the UK’s most industriousness taxpayers and is grossly skewed in favour of the super-rich, who can effectively avoid millions of pounds of tax by opting to pay £30,000. It is made even more painful in that it is a surcharge not a tax, so it cannot be offset by a foreign tax credit. Surely the Government’s intentions are noble, but the proposal conveys a churlish and even hostile attitude to foreign workers by implying that they are fair game for a tax grab -- is it mere coincidence that they do not have the right to vote?  This proposal should be abandoned altogether, or at least revised to affect only non-doms with more than 17 years residence. Thank you for signing!
